tool.name: UpdateWROLayerInfo

param.name: inMosaic
param.dialogReference: Input weighted overlay mosaic. Use the Create Weighted Overlay Mosaic tool to create a new mosaic before running this tool.
param.pythonReference: Input weighted overlay mosaic. Use the Create Weighted Overlay Mosaic tool to create a new mosaic before running this tool.

param.name: in_mosaic_row
param.dialogReference: The layer in the mosaic that you want to change. Choose the layer from the dropdown. All parameters below this dropdown will populate with the data specific to this layer. You cannot change this parameter.
param.pythonReference: The layer in the mosaic that you want to change.

param.name: wroTitle
param.dialogReference: The title of the layer that will appear in the Suitability modeler widget in GeoPlanner or Web AppBuilder.
param.pythonReference: The title of the layer that will appear in the Suitability modeler widget in GeoPlanner or Web AppBuilder.

param.name: wroLayerDescription
param.dialogReference: The description of the layer that will appear as a tooltip in the Suitability modeler widget in GeoPlanner or Web AppBuilder.
param.pythonReference: The title of the layer that will appear as a tooltip in the Suitability modeler widget in GeoPlanner or Web AppBuilder.

param.name: wroLayerPreviewURL
param.dialogReference:
URL to a hosted image layer. When this parameter is populated with a valid URL to an image layer, the Suitability Modeler widget in GeoPlanner or Web AppBuilder will display a preview icon next to layer title. The icon enables you to toggle on and off a preview of a layer within the mosaic dataset. You must share each raster layer that you want to preview as an image service. Here's an example using a layer from the World Ecophysiographic Service:

https://landscape6.arcgis.com/arcgis/rest/services/WRO_Previews/Distance_to_Water/ImageServer
param.pythonReference:
URL to a hosted image layer. When this parameter is populated with a valid URL to an image layer, the Suitability Modeler widget in GeoPlanner or Web AppBuilder will display a preview icon next to layer title. The icon enables you to toggle on and off a preview of a layer within the mosaic dataset. You must share each raster layer that you want to preview as an image service. Here's an example using a layer from the World Ecophysiographic Service:

https://landscape6.arcgis.com/arcgis/rest/services/WRO_Previews/Distance_to_Water/ImageServer

param.name: wroLayerInfoURL
param.dialogReference:
An informational URL. Use this parameter to display a page that contains metadata or more information about a layer within your suitability modeling service. When this parameter is populated with a valid URL, the Suitability Modeler widget in GeoPlanner or Web AppBuilder will display an Info icon next to layer title. The icon enables you to display and right-click a link to open the URL in a new browser tab. Here's an example URL that references Esri's USA NLCD Land Cover Change 2006-2011 ArcGIS Item:

https://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=9cba78a03af1463da674fd28d254ba0e
param.pythonReference:
An informational URL. Use this parameter to display a page that contains metadata or more information about a layer within your suitability modeling service. When this parameter is populated with a valid URL, the Suitability Modeler widget in GeoPlanner or Web AppBuilder will display an Info icon next to layer title. The icon enables you to display and right-click a link to open the URL in a new browser tab. Here's an example URL that references Esri's USA NLCD Land Cover Change 2006-2011 ArcGIS Item:

https://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=9cba78a03af1463da674fd28d254ba0e

param.name: wroLayerNoDataRanges
param.dialogReference: A value in your raster dataset that you want to remap to NoData. No Data values knock-out other values when used in an overlay.
param.pythonReference: A value in your raster dataset that you want to remap to NoData. No Data values knock-out other values when used in an overlay.

tool.summary: Updates layer information in a weighted overlay mosaic. This tool allows you to change a layer's title and description, add a preview or informational URL and define a dataset value range as NoData.
